intro: Weihea excisa, commonly known as the Hawaiian tree fern, is a member of the Cyatheaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly Hawaii, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features a tall, unbranched trunk covered in a thick layer of persistent, fibrous roots. Its fronds are large, feather-like, and can reach lengths of up to 3 meters. Weihea excisa plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian forests, providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
